If they prefer something with a bit more mystery and suspense, 'The Secret' would be a better fit. It's about a man who discovers a dark secret that alters his life in unexpected ways.

If they're looking for something more action-packed and thrilling, 'Taken' is a great choice. It's about a group of friends who are kidnapped and forced to participate in a dangerous game.

If you're looking for a movie about the challenges faced by a monarch, 'Elizabeth' (1998) starring Fanny Ardant is a great choice. It explores the complex relationship between a young queen and her advisors, highlighting the sacrifices and sacrifices required to maintain her position.

If you prefer something with a more dramatic and gritty tone, 'End of Watch' (2016) starring David Harbour and Jake Gyllenhaal might be more up your alley. It follows the daily lives of two police officers in LA, emphasizing the dangers and moral complexities of their work.

If you're interested in a lighter and more humorous film, 'Taxi Driver' (1976) starring Joe Spinell is a must-watch. It's a witty and nostalgic exploration of the lives of lonely individuals navigating loneliness and finding solace in each other.
